passages.text: Solid 2Q25 results with decent asset-quality trend allowing for provision release; interim dividend declared

CMB reported 1H25 PPOP down -2.7% YoY to RMB111.9bn and 1H25 NPAT growth of +0.3% YoY to RMB74.9bn, above our preview expectation (accounting for 50% of FY25 consensus estimate). 2Q25 PPOP fell -1.2% YoY (a narrower decline vs. -4.2% YoY in 1Q25), dragged by muted fee and trading income. 2Q25 NPAT growth came in faster, +2.7% YoY (a decent acceleration vs. -2.1% YoY in 1Q15), thanks to provision release (-6.9% YoY in 2Q25). ROA/ROE were down -7bp/-106bp YoY to 1.2%/14.15% in 2Q25. CMB declared an interim dividend for 1H25 with payout ratio at 35% (comparable to 35% for 2024), payable in January-February 2026.

**Key Positives** — Despite notable efforts to trim its discount bill balance in 2Q25 (-16.4% QoQ / -20% YoY), loan growth came in more resilient than expected, +0.2% QoQ / +5.5% YoY in 2Q25 (vs. +3.1% QoQ / +4.3% YoY in 1Q25), thanks to both corporate and retail loan books, up +1.3% / +0.54% QoQ. While corporate lending has been driven by the power, wholesale/retail trade, and manufacturing sectors, up +26%/+20%/+18% YoY in 1H25, retail lending has focused on other retail loans/mortgage/personal business loans, up +7%/+5%/+4% YoY in 1H25. As deposit growth (+1.1% QoQ / +8.5% YoY in 2Q25) outpaced loan book growth of +0.2% QoQ in 2Q25, LDR fell -0.65ppt QoQ to 74.8% in 2Q25. **Asset quality:** NPL ratio fell 1bp QoQ to 0.93% in 2Q25, thanks to notably reduced corporate NPL ratio down -14bp HoH to 0.93% in 1H25 (driven by lower NPL ratio across most sectors), helping offset the negative from modest retail NPL ratio increase by +6bp HoH to 1.03% in 1H25 (due to higher retail NPL ratio in other retail loans / micro finance loans, up +32bp / +16bp HoH to 1.46%/0.95% in 1H25, offsetting the mortgage NPL ratio decline by -2bp HoH to 0.46% in 1H25). After adding back write-offs, gross NPL formation was broadly stable at 0.62% (flat QoQ) in 2Q25. Meanwhile, SML ratio fell 20bp QoQ to 1.17% in 2Q25. Amid decent asset-quality trend in 2Q25, CMB modestly reduced credit cost to 66bp in 2Q25 (-7bp QoQ / -8bp YoY), while still keeping its NPL coverage ratio steady at 410.9% in 2Q25 (+0.9ppt QoQ). (Continued below)
Source: Powered by dataCentral
BuyPrice (29 Aug 25 16:10)HK$48.00Target priceHK$54.04Expected share price12.6%returnExpected dividend yield4.6%Expected total return17.2%Market CapHK$1,210,553MUS$155,325M

Citi Research is a division of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (the "Firm"), which does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the Firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision. Certain products (not inconsistent with the author's published research) are available only on Citi's portals.

Key Positives: Retail AUM growth maintained decent momentum, \(+3\%\) QoQ / \(+12.9\%\) YoY in 2Q25 (vs. \(+4.3\%\) QoQ / \(+12.3\%\) YoY in 1Q25) to reach RMB16tr, underpinned by a solid increase in premium customers (with minimum total daily average assets of RMB500k/month), up \(2.9\%\) QoQ / \(+12.7\%\) YoY in 2Q25 (vs. \(+4.6\%\) QoQ / \(+12.4\%\) YoY in 1Q25). Private banking customers (with minimum total daily average assets of RMB10mn/month) also grew decently at \(+3.5\%\) QoQ to 182.7k in 2Q25 (albeit a slight deceleration vs. \(+4.4\%\) QoQ in 1Q25). Effective tax rate fell \(- 1.75\) ppt YoY to \(15.2\%\) in 2Q25, likely thanks to increased government bond investment, which carries tax exemption (investment as a percentage of total assets reached \(31.4\%\) in 2Q25, \(+2.4\) ppt YoY).

Key Negatives: NIM fell- 5bp QoQ to \(1.86\%\) in 2Q25, mainly due to lower asset yield (- 13bp QoQ in 2Q25, likely due to lower lending yield amid ongoing loan repricing), which more than offset the positive from falling funding cost (- 8bp QoQ in 2Q25, likely thanks to lower deposit cost as past deposit rate cut bears fruit). Fee income growth remained weak, down \(- 1.2\%\) YoY in 2Q25 (albeit a slightly narrower decline vs. \(- 2.5\%\) YoY in 1Q25), likely on weak bank card fee (- 16% YoY in 1H25) offsetting the positive from higher WM fee income (+12% YoY in 1H25). Trading income was mixed, \(+40.8\%\) QoQ / \(- 5\%\) YoY to RMB14.3bn in 2Q25, mainly due to high base of 2Q24, which formed \(16.8\%\) of total revenue in 2Q25 (+4.5ppt QoQ / - 0.8ppt YoY). CIR ratio increased \(+0.55\) ppt YoY to \(34.8\%\) in 2Q25, mainly due to revenue weakness (- 0.4% YoY in 2Q25), while OPEX look well under control at \(+1.2\%\) YoY in 2Q25. CET1/ Tier- 1/total CAR fell- 86bp/- 36bp/- 50bp QoQ to \(14\% /17.07\%\) \(18.56\%\) mainly due to payout of 2024 dividend.

CMB's credit risk- bearing RE- related exposure (including credit lines, proprietary bond, and non- standardized credit asset investment, etc.) shrank \(- 2.67\%\) QoQ to RMB361bn in 2Q25 (vs. \(- 0.87\%\) QoQ in 1Q25), of which \(+85\%\) of developer loans were associated with properties in urban areas of Tier- 1/2 cities. By credit asset type, RMB280.3bn was for corporate RE loan in 2Q25, down \(- 2.4\%\) QoQ (vs. \(+0.3\%\) QoQ in 1Q25), equivalent to \(4.56\%\) of total loan book in 2Q25 (- 23bps QoQ). Meanwhile, non- credit risk- bearing RE- related exposure (e.g., wealth management funds, entrusted loans, trust products under agency sales, etc.) was reduced more visibly by \(- 5.9\%\) QoQ to RMB194.3bn in 2Q25 (vs. \(- 7.4\%\) QoQ in 1Q25).

Implications: We expect the market to react positively to CMB's better- than- expected 2Q25 earnings growth, backed by solid asset quality trend. Retail asset quality pressure appears more manageable than expected, possibly due to CMB's more established retail franchise, serving the more prime/higher- quality retail customer segments vs. other China banks—e.g., CMB's mortgage NPL ratio has remained on a downtrend, - 2bp HoH to \(0.46\%\) in 1H25, while most other covered China banks have seen mortgage NPL ratio uptick HoH in 1H25. This has likely helped create room for provision release, helping boost CMB's 1H25 earnings growth back to positive territory (+0.3% YoY in 1H25). We will seek more details at CMB's analyst briefing at 9:30 a.m. on 1 September 2025.
Source:Citi Research,Company data

China Merchants Bank (CMB) was founded on April 8, 1987 with its head office in Shenzhen. It is the first shareholding commercial bank wholly owned by corporate legal entities and trades on both the Shanghai Stock Exchange and Hong Kong Stock Exchange. China Merchants Bank is principally engaged in providing banking and other related financial services. The bank has branches in more than 30 major cities in China as well as Hong Kong, and its outlets have reached over 400. CMB also has a US representative office in New York.

We have a Buy rating on CMB H- shares. As a leading retail bank with a proven track record, we believe CMB still looks well- positioned to capture the long- term growth potential in retail banking. Its high NPL coverage ratio should also enable the bank to deliver better- than- peers earnings growth. CMB is leading peers across various risk indicators thanks to little legacy NPL burden and more conservative/market- oriented credit culture.

We use an Economic Value Added (EVA) model to determine our target price of HK\$54.04 for CMB H- shares. EVA is commonly used to value banks, especially when rate liberalization has kicked off and ROE is likely to drop. Our assumptions include a sustainable ROE of \(11\%\) and long- term growth of \(3\%\) . We adopt a cost- of- equity of \(12.1\%\) , which suggests a fair 2026E P/B of 0.95x.

Key downside risks that could prevent the shares from achieving our EVAbased target price include: 1) any capital raising; 2) a property price correction given the bank's large exposure to mortgages; 3) vulnerability to regulatory scrutiny against WMP given the bank's larger exposure to WMP; and 4) macro environment risks.

If you are visually impaired and would like to speak to a Citi representative regarding the details of the graphics in this document, please call USA 1- 888- 500- 5008 (TTY: 711), from outside the US +1- 210- 677- 3788

Analysts' compensation is determined by Citi Research management and Citigroup's senior management and is based upon activities and services intended to benefit the investor clients of Citigroup Global Markets Inc. and its affiliates (the "Firm"). Compensation is not linked to specific transactions or recommendations. Like all Firm employees, analysts receive compensation that is impacted by overall Firm profitability which includes investment banking, sales and trading, and principal trading revenues. One factor in equity research analyst compensation is arranging corporate access events between institutional clients and the management teams of covered companies. Typically, company management is more likely to participate when the analyst has a positive view of the company.

Citi Research stock recommendations include an investment rating and an optional risk rating to highlight high risk stocks. Risk rating takes into account both price volatility and fundamental criteria. Stocks will either have no risk rating or a High risk rating assigned.

Investment Ratings: Citi Research investment ratings are Buy, Neutral and Sell. Our ratings are a function of analyst expectations of expected total return ("ETR") and risk. ETR is the sum of the forecast price appreciation (or depreciation) plus the dividend yield for a stock within the next 12 months. The target price is based on a 12 month time horizon. The Investment rating definitions are: Buy (1) ETR of \(15\%\) or more or \(25\%\) or more for High risk stocks; and Sell (3) for negative ETR. Any covered stock not assigned a Buy or a Sell is a Neutral (2). For stocks rated Neutral (2), if an analyst believes that there are insufficient valuation drivers and/or investment catalysts to derive a positive or negative investment view, they may elect with the approval of Citi Research management not to assign a target price and, thus, not derive an ETR. Citi Research may suspend its rating and target price and assign "Rating Suspended" status for regulatory and/or internal policy reasons. Citi Research may also suspend its rating and target price and assign "Under Review" status for other exceptional circumstances (e.g. lack of information critical to the analyst's thesis, trading suspension) affecting the company and/or trading in the company's securities. In both such situations, the rating and target price will show as "-" and "-" respectively in the rating history price chart. Prior to 11 April 2022 Citi Research assigned "Under Review" status to both situations and prior to 11 Nov 2020 only in exceptional circumstances. As soon as practically possible, the analyst will publish a note re-establishing a rating and investment thesis. Investment ratings are determined by the ranges described above at the time of initiation of coverage, a change in investment and/or risk rating, or a change in target price (subject to limited management discretion). At times, the expected total returns may fall outside of these ranges because of market price movements and/or other short-term volatility or trading patterns. Such interim deviations will be permitted but will become subject to review by Research Management. Your decision to buy or sell a security should be based upon your personal investment objectives and should be made only after evaluating the stock's expected performance and risk.

Catalyst Watch and STV Upside/Downside calls: Citi Research may also include a Catalyst Watch or STV Upside or Downside call to indicate the analyst expects the share price to rise (fall) in absolute terms over a specified period of 30 or 90 days in reaction to one or more specific near- term catalysts or events impacting the company or the market. A Catalyst Watch will be published when Analyst confidence is high that an impact to share price will occur; it will be a STV when confidence level is moderate. A Catalyst Watch or STV Upside/Downside call will automatically expire at the end of the specified 30/90 day

period. The Catalyst Watch will also be automatically removed if share price performance (calculated at market close) exceeds \(15\%\) against the direction of the call (unless over- ridden by the analyst). The analyst may also remove a Catalyst Watch or STV call prior to the end of the specified period in a published research note. A Catalyst Watch/STV Upside or Downside call may be different from and does not affect a stock's fundamental equity rating, which reflects a longer- term total absolute return expectation. For purposes of FINRA ratings- distribution- disclosure rules, a Catalyst Watch/STV Upside call corresponds to a buy recommendation and a Catalyst Watch/STV Downside call corresponds to a sell recommendation. Any stock not assigned to a Catalyst Watch Upside, Catalyst Watch Downside, STV Upside, or STV Downside call is considered Catalyst Watch/STV No View. For purposes of FINRA ratings distribution- disclosure rules, we correspond Catalyst Watch/STV No View to Hold in our ratings distribution table for our Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside rating system. However, we reiterate that we do not consider No View to be a recommendation. For all Catalyst Watch/STV Upside/Downside calls, risk exists that the catalyst(s) and associated share- price movement will not materialize as expected.
